title: i feel like a horrible person, and im really struggling to stay in my relationship right now
self_text: so me (30m) and my gf (29f) have been dating for about 8 months now, we’ve known each other since high school but never talked until last year. it started off pretty slow, mostly texting and hanging out occasionally with our friend groups together, then we started going on dates and things escalated from there. shes really sweet and caring, and loves animals which is something i really admire, she has two cats that are very affectionate and love cuddles. she works as an assistant teacher at the local elementary school and is super good at her job, all of the kids adore her and she gets along great with the staff and parents. ive always had a thing for teachers, so thats definitely a plus lol. shes also very smart and intelligent, even though she didnt go to college, she taught herself how to code and currently freelances doing web development stuff while looking for a full time job. tbh shes basically everything i ever wanted in a girl, so why am i feeling this way? well here's where things get tricky...  i have a history of cheating in previous relationships, and its something i really struggle with. im not proud of it, and im ashamed of what i did, but im still trying to work through it and be better. i think part of it comes from being insecure and wanting validation from others, but i know that doesnt excuse my actions. when i met my gf, i was determined to be faithful and honest, and i truly want to make this relationship work. i tried to cut off contact with any girls who were giving me attention, and i made sure to tell my gf if anyone flirted with me or made me uncomfortable. she was understanding and supportive, and she helped me navigate those situations without getting into trouble. however, recently things have changed. we went on vacation together a couple weeks ago, and it was amazing! we spent hours just talking and laughing, and we got closer than ever before. but when we came home, i started to feel restless again. i found myself checking social media more often, and i even started flirting with some girls online. i felt guilty immediately after doing it, and i stopped myself before anything could happen, but the fact that i even considered it is eating away at me.   i told my gf about it yesterday, and she was understandably upset. she said she needed space to process everything, and i completely respect that. i hate hurting her, and i dont want to lose her, but i feel like im constantly fighting against my own demons.  im starting therapy next week, and im hoping it will help me understand why i do these things and how to stop them. but right now, im just feeling lost and confused. im scared that ill end up ruining another relationship, and im tired of being this person. im really struggling to stay positive and hopeful, and im wondering if maybe im just not capable of being in a healthy, monogamous relationship. does anyone else struggle with this? how do you cope?  tl;dr: im a serial cheater trying to change, and im scared im gonna ruin another relationship.  edit: thanks for the support everyone, im glad im not alone in this. i appreciate the advice and encouragement, and ill definitely take it to heart. im committed to working on myself, and hopefully i can become the partner my gf deserves.

title: How do I tell my daughter she’s wrong?
self_text: My (26F) daughter (5F) is very smart and perceptive, but also a little bit spoiled and demanding. She’s been asking for a new phone for about a year now, even though her current one is still working just fine. She knows that I don’t want to buy her a new phone right now because we are saving up for other things, like furniture and home repairs. She has also asked me to go to Disney World, which is something I can’t afford right now either.   I understand that it’s hard for a child to hear “no,” especially when they really want something. But I think it’s important for her to learn that she can’t always get what she wants, and that sometimes she needs to accept the fact that things aren’t going to go her way.   So how do I tell her that she’s wrong without making her feel bad or hurt? Should I try to explain the financial situation in more detail, or should I just stick to saying “no”?

title: what do you think of the song “godspeed” by frank ocean?
self_text: i just heard it for the first time and i really like it, but im not sure if its good or something

title: my bf (32m) and i (31f) have been together for nearly 4 years, he has never met my family or me his. we’ve always lived in different states but recently moved closer to each other! so that’s great! it still feels like a big step though, since he's the only person who knows about my condition. is this normal?
self_text: i am looking forward to meeting his mom and sister next week! they are both really excited to meet me too! he says he's nervous, which makes sense lol. any advice?

I get so bored that I end up playing video games all day. And if there isn’t anything to do, I just go on my phone. But then I start thinking about how lonely I am. I feel like I could use a friend. But I also feel like nobody would want to be friends with me. Is there anything I can do?

title: i feel like everyone is talking about how they are going to die alone and im starting to think its gonna happen to me too :(
self_text: yeah so basically i’m afraid of dying alone, i don’t want my last moments on earth to be spent alone in a hospital bed or something like that, what if the people i love just aren’t around when it happens? idk man i’m scared to death tbh

title: I’m feeling really lonely today, especially since my boyfriend and I have been drifting apart recently
self_text: It feels like we barely talk anymore and it hurts me so much to see him slowly slipping away from me. He used to be the most important person in my life, but now it seems like he doesn’t even care about me or what I’m going through. I try to reach out to him, but he always pushes me away and tells me that he needs space. I don’t know what to do anymore. I love him so much, but I can’t keep living like this. I just want things to go back to how they were, but I know that’s probably not possible.

self_text: I’m a 24M who is recently divorced and am trying to get out more but don’t know where to start. Any advice would be appreciated!

title: I'm a student and have to write an essay about the history of my home city. My hometown is very small, what should I do?
self_text: So as you can see from the title, I am a student who has to write an essay about the history of my home city.   My hometown is really small so there isn't much information online or in books, etc.  I was wondering if anyone had any suggestions on how to write it, or how to find out more info?   Thanks in advance!

title: i'm scared to tell my parents that i don't want kids in the future because they said they will be disappointed if i didn't have any kids
self_text: so, my parents are very religious and conservative. they believe marriage is a holy sacrament and it should always be between a man and a woman (even though i’m gay). they also think people should have children, and they’ve been saying for years how much they would love to become grandparents.   i told them a few months ago that i was considering being childfree. their response wasn’t great, to say the least. they basically accused me of being selfish, and they said they would be “very disappointed” if i didn’t have kids.  they tried to guilt trip me by telling me that having children is what gives life meaning and purpose. they said that without children, i would never know true happiness or fulfillment. they even brought up biblical references about procreation.  i understand that they come from a different generation with different values, but it still hurt to hear them say those things. i feel like they weren’t really listening to me when i explained why i don’t want kids. i just wanted them to respect my decision, but they didn’t seem interested in doing that.  now, i’m afraid to bring it up again. i don’t want to cause more conflict or disappointment. but i also don’t want to live my life based on what other people expect of me. i want to be able to make my own choices and live my life authentically.  any advice?

title: I just want to be a kid again
self_text: I miss being able to sleep in and not have responsibilities, or stress about what bills are due, or having to work or even doing chores around the house because my parents did it for me.  I wish I could just go back to being a little kid where all that mattered was school, playing with friends, eating snacks, watching cartoons and going on vacation.  I really don't like growing up, adulting is so hard and sucks so much.

title: Thoughts on the fact that I'm really afraid of falling in love, even though it seems like such a wonderful thing?
self_text: It's just that I think I'm not ready for something so big and intense. But at the same time, I can't help but feel like I'm missing out on something important. I wish there was a way to experience the joy of love without having to worry about getting hurt. Is this normal?

title: AITA for not wanting to share my food with my family?
self_text: I’ve always been a picky eater and have had issues with eating around others, even as a child. My mother doesn’t understand why I don’t want to eat the same things that everyone else does, but she has never forced me to eat anything (though it would be nice if she didn’t try to convince me to). She thinks that because I have tried something once, I should like it forever, which is really annoying.   I am currently living with my parents and two siblings. They are both very athletic and seem to live at the gym.  My mom makes sure we all get enough protein every day, so our meals usually consist of meat and vegetables.   Recently, my mother made chicken breast and broccoli for dinner. I wasn’t in the mood for either, so I asked her if I could just have some rice instead. She said no, saying that I need to eat my protein.   So, I ate the chicken and broccoli and pretended to enjoy it, though I really didn’t.   After dinner, my brother started complaining about how much he hates chicken and broccoli. My sister chimed in too.   I was annoyed because they were complaining about the same thing that I had just endured. So, I told them that I also hated chicken and broccoli.   They got upset with me and accused me of being rude.  They said that I shouldn’t complain about their dinners when I don’t eat what my mother makes me.   I explained that I only ate it because my mother told me I had to, but they wouldn’t listen.   Now they are giving me the silent treatment and ignoring me whenever I talk to them.   AITA?

title: My friend is being a jerk and I don't know what to do anymore
self_text: So, my friend (let's call him Tim) has been acting like a jerk lately. He has been ignoring me for weeks, and when he does talk to me, it's just to be mean or sarcastic.   I don't understand why he's doing this, but it's really hurting my feelings. I have tried talking to him about it, but he just brushes it off and says that I'm overreacting.  I feel like I'm walking on eggshells around him all the time, and I'm starting to dread seeing him. I used to enjoy spending time with him, but now I just feel anxious and uncomfortable.  I don't want to lose our friendship, but I don't know how much longer I can put up with his behavior. What should I do?

title: I'm a trans girl who is trying to come out to my family, but they are very conservative and religious so how do I approach them?
self_text: My parents have always been very conservative and religious so it's hard for me to think of coming out to them because I fear that they won't accept me. They also don't really talk about LGBT stuff or anything like that so it makes it even harder to think about telling them. So any advice would be greatly appreciated.

title: i just want to be held
self_text: and told everything is going to be okay, even if it’s not.

title: AITA for wanting my boyfriend to not be around my family anymore?
self_text: My (24F) boyfriend, (28M), and I have been together for about a year now. We’ve had our ups and downs but overall we’re very happy together.   My parents are divorced, with me living with my mom since the divorce when I was in middle school. My dad lives out of state but I see him every once in a while when he comes into town or vice versa. He remarried about five years ago and has two sons from his marriage that are currently still living at home.  I am close with my mom and brothers, but it's just never really worked out between me and my step-brothers. They were a lot older than me and always seemed to resent my existence because they felt like their dad didn't care about them as much after meeting me. The feelings haven't gotten any better over time.  As for my dad, he is an amazing man who loves me very much. However, he does have some issues with controlling people, especially my mother. He doesn't seem to realize how bad his behavior can be and will often make decisions without consulting anyone else. It got so bad that my mom filed for divorce because she couldn't stand being controlled by him any longer.  When my boyfriend started coming around my house more often, he quickly became friends with my step-brothers and started hanging out with them whenever he came over. This wouldn't bother me if they weren't such awful people, but they tend to pick on me all the time. Whenever my boyfriend would come over, they would start making fun of me for things like having acne or wearing certain clothes. I tried to brush it off at first, but it eventually started getting to me.  Then there's my dad. When my boyfriend would come over, my dad would constantly try to "one up" him. He'd talk about his accomplishments at work, brag about how much money he makes, and generally try to make my boyfriend feel inferior. I noticed that my boyfriend would get visibly uncomfortable whenever my dad did this, but he never said anything.  I've talked to both my step-brothers and my dad about their behavior, but they don't seem to understand why it bothers me. They say I'm too sensitive and need to learn to take a joke. My dad says he's just trying to be friendly and wants to get to know my boyfriend better.  I'm starting to dread having my boyfriend come over to my house. I love him very much, but I don't want him to have to deal with my dysfunctional family. I think it would be best if he stopped visiting my house altogether. Am I the asshole for wanting this?

title: My ex just blocked me on everything after I said "I miss you" (we've been broken up for 3 months)
self_text: So, as the title states, my ex blocked me on everything today after I told him that I missed him over text. We broke up about 3 months ago and haven’t really talked much since then (mostly because he ghosted me a bit). He has recently started responding to my texts again, but it hasn’t been anything meaningful (just like “how are you?” or “what have you been doing lately?”), so I figured there was no harm in telling him that I missed him.  Apparently, there was. I guess he didn’t want to hear that from me?   It feels pretty bad to be blocked by someone who used to mean so much to me, especially when I was just trying to be honest with him about how I felt. It makes me wonder if maybe I should have just kept quiet and pretended that I didn’t care anymore. But honestly, I don’t think I could have done that. I wanted him to know that I still had feelings for him, even though I knew that things were probably never going to work out between us.  I wish he would have just told me if he wasn’t interested instead of blocking me without saying anything. It just seems like such a cowardly thing to do.  But whatever, I guess. If he doesn’t want to talk to me, then fine. I can live with that. I just hope that someday he will realize that he made a mistake and come back to me. But until then, I need to focus on myself and move on with my life.

title: Ahhh I'm getting there
self_text: So I have been in a really bad place for the past year, and have been dealing with panic attacks every day. It was so bad that I couldn't even leave my house because of the anxiety. But I started therapy about two months ago and it has helped me so much. I still get anxious sometimes but I am able to manage it now. And I can finally go out again without being afraid of having a panic attack.  I know I still have a long way to go but I am so proud of myself for how far I have come.  I just wanted to share this with you guys because I know there are a lot of people here who are struggling with anxiety. You are not alone and there is hope. If I can do it then so can you. :)

title: I'm really tired of being the only adult in my life, am I wrong for wanting to stop making sure everyone is okay?
self_text: My mom (57f) has had a really bad week with her depression and anxiety. She has been getting into fights with almost every single person she knows and says that people are trying to hurt her or control her when they aren’t. She called me at 3am last night while screaming and crying about how someone was stalking her and how she felt like they were going to kill her. She said she called the police but didn’t give them any information. I stayed up all night talking to her until she finally fell asleep. This morning, I woke up and found out she went to work and got into another fight with her boss. She then came home and started fighting with my brother over something he did. When I tried to intervene, she turned on me and told me I don’t care about her because I haven’t talked to her as much lately. I told her I have been busy with school and work and that I can’t just drop everything whenever she needs me. She accused me of being selfish and uncaring. I know my mom has always struggled with mental health issues, but it feels like it’s gotten worse recently. It’s exhausting constantly having to deal with her emotional outbursts and drama. I feel like I’m the only one in my family who tries to be rational and calm during these situations. Everyone else either enables her behavior or avoids her altogether. I’m starting to feel resentful towards my mom and I don’t want to spend as much time with her anymore. Is it wrong of me to want to distance myself from someone who consistently makes me feel emotionally drained? I love my mom, but I need to take care of myself too.

title: I have to ask, did anyone else ever feel like they were being haunted by a ghost?
self_text: So, this happened when I was in the third grade and had just moved into a new house with my mom. One night, I was sleeping in my room and woke up suddenly because I heard someone whispering my name. It sounded like it was coming from inside my head, but I couldn't be sure.   I looked around the room, but didn't see anything. The only light in the room came from the streetlights outside, so it was pretty dark. I tried to go back to sleep, but I kept hearing the whispering. It started to get louder and more insistent, and I started to feel really scared.  I finally got out of bed and went to find my mom. When I told her what was happening, she said that it was probably just my imagination running wild. But I knew that it wasn't my imagination. I could feel something in the room with me, and it was making me feel really uneasy.  My mom stayed with me for a while, but eventually she left me alone again. As soon as she left, the whispering started again. This time, it was accompanied by a cold breeze. I could feel it on my skin, and it made me shiver.  I started to cry, and I huddled under the covers. I prayed that whatever was in the room would leave me alone. After a few minutes, the whispering stopped and the cold breeze disappeared. I finally fell asleep, but I didn't sleep very well that night.  The next day, I asked my mom if we could move. She said that we couldn't afford to move, so I had to learn to live with it. And I did. But I never forgot that night. To this day, I still wonder who or what was whispering my name.

title: I'm the only person who doesn't like them?
self_text: I love everyone but I don't think I can be friends with people who are very passionate about something that is bad for me. It's not that they're necessarily trying to make me do it, but it just makes things awkward. They're all really nice and good people though, so I feel guilty about not being able to get over my issues with their interests.  I also feel like a snob because I have such strong opinions about what others should or shouldn't enjoy. But if someone wants to hang out with me, I need to know what kind of vibe they give off before I say yes. If they're too into something that's unhealthy, then I'm going to shut down immediately.

title: I need a reality check, am I being an ah?
self_text: So recently my mom has been saying how she's noticed that I have been spending alot of time with the kids and their dad (my ex) and is worried about me getting back together with him. She said it was good for the kids to see us co-parenting but she wants me to be careful because she knows I still love him.  She also asked me if he had someone else in his life and when I told her no, she then said something along the lines of "that doesn't mean anything" and started going on about all the things that happened between us. I ended up crying and telling her that I don't want to get back together with him and that I'm just trying to be a good mom.  I know he's changed since we broke up but there are still some parts of me that miss him. But I've also been working on myself and growing as a person, so I don't think I would ever go back to him.   Is my mom right to worry about me getting back together with him? Or is she just being overprotective?

title: I feel so lonely and isolated. What should I do?
self_text: I am a college student and I have no friends. My parents are very supportive, but they don't understand what it is like to be in college. They think that I should just go out and make friends, but it is not that easy.  I have tried joining clubs and activities, but I always end up feeling awkward and out of place. I don't know how to talk to people and I don't know how to make friends.   I feel like I am missing out on the best years of my life. I see all of my classmates hanging out with their friends and having fun, and I just want to be able to experience that too. But I don't know how to get there.  I also feel like I am not good enough for anyone. I am not attractive, I am not smart, and I am not funny. I just feel like I am a burden to everyone around me.  I know that I need to work on myself and try to become more confident, but I don't know where to start. I am so lost and confused.  I wish I could just disappear.

title: I want to buy a cat
self_text: Is there anything that I need to know before buying a cat? Like, what do cats like and dislike? What are some things I should avoid when taking care of my new friend? Also, how can I make sure that the cat is comfortable in its new home? Any advice would be greatly appreciated!

title: I think my brother is a narcissist, am I being ridiculous?
self_text: My brother and I have never been close but he’s always tried to make me feel like it was my fault, even when I was a child. He moved out for college about six years ago and has come back home once or twice since then. He lives with our parents now. He doesn’t work so they support him, which is fine because he’s going to school full time. But his behavior lately has become unbearable.   He gets upset if anyone does anything without him, whether it’s going out to eat or just watching TV. If you don’t invite him, he will get angry at you.   I went on vacation with my mom last month, she invited my sister-in-law but not him. She said that he would have ruined the trip because of how annoying he can be. I agree. So I didn’t tell him we were going until after we got back. When I told him, he started yelling at us about how rude we were to leave him out. Then he asked what we did. We told him everything and he got upset again because he wasn’t there.  We all know he’s jealous of our relationships with each other. He’s very insecure.  Then he started telling everyone how much he hated being around people who are “fake” or “negative.”  I also learned he had a girlfriend for three months and hadn’t told anyone. He broke up with her two weeks ago and is still mad at her.  My mom thinks he needs therapy. I think he needs to grow up and stop acting like an immature little boy. Am I overreacting?

title: I think my gf is leaving me after I broke up with her mom and sister
self_text: So my gf's mom has been very toxic to me, she always tries to come between us or make us fight, so I decided to cut contact with both of them because they were getting in the way of our relationship. My gf was upset but understood that I needed space from her family for our relationship to work out. After cutting contact, my girlfriend began to act weird and cold towards me, so I tried talking to her about it, but she just brushed me off. Eventually, I got fed up and ended things with her because she didn't want to talk about it. Now I regret breaking up with her and trying to fix things, but she doesn't seem interested at all. Am I overthinking it? Is she really done with me? Should I just let her go?

title: I’m a grown man and I’m still insecure about my height
self_text: I’m 5’7” and have been for years, but I can never get over the fact that I’m not tall. I was always the shortest kid in school and it made me feel really bad about myself.  I know that height isn’t everything, but it’s something that I just can’t shake off.  My dad is 6’2” and my mom is 5’8”, so I always felt like I should be taller than I am.  I try to tell myself that it doesn’t matter, but I still catch myself comparing myself to other men and feeling inadequate.  It’s ridiculous, I know, but I can’t help it.  What do you think? Am I being unreasonable? Should I just accept that I’m short and move on?

title: I'm a terrible friend and I need to stop it
self_text: So, I just got out of the hospital for being in acute mania and after that they sent me to a psychiatric ward because there was no room at my house. Now I'm here trying to figure out what happened and why I did all those things. It feels like I have no control over myself. Sometimes I feel like I'm not even present when I'm doing something. Then I wake up and find out everything I've done. I can't remember any of it.  I keep thinking about how much my friends must hate me now. They always tell me they love me but I don't believe them. I think they only say that so I won't kill myself.

title: I think my friend is a narcissist, what should i do?
self_text: Okay so basically my friend and i have been friends for about three years now, we met at university and got along really well because of our shared interest in anime.  But as time went on, i started to notice some things that made me uncomfortable. He would constantly interrupt me when i was talking, he would always talk about himself and his achievements and he would get angry if i didn’t agree with him.  I tried to ignore these things at first, but they started to bother me more and more. I started to feel like i couldn’t be myself around him anymore.  I also noticed that he would often try to control me. He would tell me what to wear, what to eat, and who to hang out with. He would get angry if i didn’t listen to him.  I finally realized that he was a narcissist when i read an article about narcissistic personality disorder. Everything in the article described him perfectly.  I don’t know what to do now. I want to remain friends with him, but i don’t want to be controlled by him anymore. What should i do?

self_text: I know it might sound bad but just wanted to see what others think!

self_text: I just finished watching it and I have a lot of thoughts, but I don't know where to start.  I also want to hear what others thought about it.

title: Finally got my period!
self_text: I’ve been tracking for a while now and it seems like I finally got my period today! It was very light, but I can finally see blood so I know it has arrived. I’m really happy about this because I have PCOS and periods are irregular at best, nonexistent at worst.   I’m not currently trying to get pregnant, but it is good to know that my body is still functioning normally.  Does anyone else here have PCOS? What did you do to help regulate your cycle?

title: Anyone else feel like they’re getting too old for the whole “adulting” thing?
self_text: I can't be the only one that feels really lost in life. Like you don't know what your doing anymore and just want to curl up with a good book or movie.

title: Is it normal to have an existential crisis as a teenager?
self_text: I’m 17 and for the past few months I’ve been having thoughts like “what is the point of everything?” And “I don’t want to do anything with my life.”  It sounds so cliche when I type it out, but it really feels overwhelming sometimes. I just feel very empty inside and I don’t know what I want to do with myself or who I am anymore.   I think the main reason why I feel this way is because everyone around me has these amazing goals in their lives that they are all working towards, while I feel lost and confused. Like I’m still trying to find my identity. It makes me wonder if I’ll ever be able to feel happy again.  Is this something that most teenagers experience? Or should I talk to someone about this?

title: I can't stop crying
self_text: My dad told me he was going to go on a trip for work and when he left my mom started yelling at him in front of me and I don't know why she yelled at him because he's always working so hard. He has been gone for 3 days now and I keep crying over it. It feels like the end of the world, but I am really trying not to cry in public.  I feel like I am losing my mind and don't know what to do.   I just want my dad home.   Is there something wrong with me?

title: Is it normal for an introvert to get bored of being alone?
self_text: I'm an introvert, so I like my own company a lot. But lately, I've been getting bored of just being by myself all the time. It's not that I don't enjoy doing things on my own, but I feel like I need more social interaction. I have a few close friends, but we don't see each other very often because we all live in different cities. I also have a family, but they're all pretty busy with their own lives. So, I end up spending most of my time alone. I know introverts are supposed to be okay with being alone, and I usually am. But lately, it feels like something is missing. Is this normal? Or am I just going through a phase?

title: Why are people always giving me the "you're not a real woman" speech?
self_text: I'm a man who identifies as a woman, and I'm tired of being told that I'm not a real woman because I don't have a vagina. It's like, okay, so what if I don't have a vagina? Does that make me any less of a woman? No.  I'm just trying to live my life and be happy, but it's hard when people are constantly telling me that I'm not good enough.  I wish people would just accept me for who I am.  I know I'm not going to change anyone's mind, but I just want them to leave me alone.  I want to be able to walk down the street without having to worry about being harassed or discriminated against.  I want to be able to go to work without having to worry about being fired.  I want to be able to live my life without having to worry about being judged.  But I guess that's too much to ask for.

title: I'm starting to feel like a disappointment in my own life
self_text: I recently lost my job and have been unemployed for the past 2 months. My friends and family are all doing well, but I feel like I'm falling behind. I don't know what to do with myself anymore. I feel like I'm just wasting my time and potential.

title: My husband asked me to get him a birthday cake for his coworker today and he has been really rude to me all day because I got the wrong one.
self_text: So my husband told me that it was his coworker’s birthday today, so he asked me to pick up a birthday cake on the way home from work. I went to Kroger, and they had two of the same kind of cakes. One said “Happy Birthday” in blue icing, while the other said “Happy Birthday” in pink icing. I picked up the pink one, thinking it would be fine.   When I got home, my husband looked at the cake and started yelling at me about how it wasn’t what he wanted. He said that he specifically asked me to get the blue one. I tried to explain to him that they both said “Happy Birthday”, but he didn’t want to hear it. He just kept yelling at me until I started crying.   I don’t understand why he would yell at me over something so small. It’s just a cake! And even if I did mess up, he could have just calmly asked me to go back and get the right one. But instead, he chose to make me feel awful about myself.   I’m starting to wonder if he’s always going to treat me like this. I feel like I can never do anything right in his eyes. I love him very much, but I don’t know if I can keep living like this.   I’ve already decided that I’m going to talk to him about this tomorrow. I need him to understand how much his words hurt me. And I need him to start treating me with respect.

title: Help me get over my ex who's pregnant with another man?
self_text: I know, it sounds bad and complicated but please hear me out. My ex broke up with me about a year ago and moved on pretty quickly with a guy that she knew since high school. She always told me how she had a crush on him during their childhood so when they got together it didn’t surprise me. They have been dating for about a year now and she just found out she is pregnant.   I was never interested in her to begin with so I don’t see why this should bother me but it does because I have been going through a really tough time lately and this made it worse.  I have lost my job, I have no friends, I am struggling with depression and anxiety, and I have been sleeping with random people as a way to cope with the pain. But now this has happened and I feel like I am getting nowhere in life while she is living happily ever after.  She also makes it seem like she is doing great in life and everything is perfect for her which makes me feel even worse. I wish I could be happy for her but I can’t because I am too busy feeling sorry for myself.   What do I do?

title: AITA for wanting my sister to pay me back?
self_text:
So I'm a single mom with a toddler and a baby, living in poverty. My sister has been working as a secretary at the hospital for over 20 years now and she is very well off financially. She makes around $5,000 per month and her husband works too so they have a lot of money coming in. 

I've always tried to be there for my sister but lately she's been really difficult to deal with. She doesn't understand that I need help with money and she just keeps telling me that I need to work harder.  She even told me once that if I was more careful with my spending then I wouldn't be poor! This made me feel like garbage. It's hard enough being a single mom with two kids who are sick all the time without having someone judge you for trying to make ends meet. 

My sister asked me to watch her dogs while she went on vacation last year and I agreed because I love animals. But when I got there, it turned out that she had 4 dogs! The place was filthy and covered in dog hair. And she didn't leave me any food or supplies for the dogs. I ended up having to go buy everything myself.   When she returned from vacation, she didn't offer to reimburse me for anything. I asked her about it and she said "Oh yeah, I totally forgot." I reminded her that she promised to pay me back for the food and supplies and she got really angry. She started yelling at me saying that I should have known better than to expect her to pay me back. She said that she did me a favor by letting me watch her dogs and that I shouldn't be asking her for money. 

I'm starting to think that my sister is just a terrible person. She doesn't care about anyone except herself and she only wants to use people.  I don't want to have anything to do with her anymore. But I still feel guilty for wanting her to pay me back. Am I wrong to ask for what I am owed?  AITA?

title: I’m getting really sick of my friends
self_text: I love them but they are all so annoying and immature, how do I deal with that?

title: AITA for wanting to watch the next episode?
self_text: I’m not a big fan of watching tv with other people, but my roommate likes it and is always asking me if I want to join him. He has asked several times if I want to watch the next episode of something we’re both watching together. I usually say no because I just like being alone and doing whatever I want. \n\nHe knows that I don’t like watching tv with others, so he started telling me when he was going to watch it and then leaving me out. We have been watching a show together for months now and he hasn’t invited me to watch it in weeks. I tried to invite him to watch it with me, but he said he had plans.  I asked what his plans were and he said nothing. Then I told him I didn’t care about his plans, I wanted him to come over and watch the show with me. He got mad at me and left.   I feel bad for making him angry, but I also think he should have invited me to watch it with him. I know he doesn’t want to watch it with me, but I wish he would have just said so instead of ignoring me. I’m starting to wonder if he just doesn’t like me anymore.    AITA?

title: Is it normal for a narcissist to get bored of someone after they’ve already worn them down?
self_text: So, I was with a man who was absolutely obsessed with me at first - but then he started gaslighting and manipulating me into believing that my own thoughts were wrong and even that I couldn’t trust anyone in my life except him.  He would tell me what I could wear, who I could hang out with, where I could go, how I should think - the whole nine yards. He made sure I didn’t have any friends or family left to turn to, because he had alienated all of them by telling them lies about me.   After months of being isolated from everyone I knew, I finally realized just how toxic he was and broke up with him. But now I’m wondering if I’m crazy or something - because he suddenly got bored of me once I became completely dependent on him. Like, he literally used me as his personal toy until I was broken, and then tossed me aside like trash when he lost interest.  Is that normal for narcissists to do? Do they get bored of their victims once they’ve completely worn them down?

title: Anyone else ever have a weird sense of longing for the days when they were addicted?
self_text: I know it sounds awful, but sometimes when I'm doing well in my recovery and things are going smoothly I feel... empty. Like something is missing. It's like I miss the highs and lows, the drama and intensity of being addicted.  I think it's because addiction took up so much space in my life that now that it's gone, there's just a big void. I'm trying to fill it with healthy things, but it's hard. It feels like I'm learning how to live all over again.   Does anyone else experience this? How do you deal with it?

title: I'm sorry for my mistakes, but I don't think it was a big deal.

title: AITA for saying I'm not a fan of my friend's son?
self_text: So, I (27M) have been friends with "Sarah" (30F) since high school. We've always gotten along well and have a lot in common. About 5 years ago, Sarah had a son named "Kevin".  I was happy for her, but honestly, Kevin is an absolute nightmare. He's constantly screaming, throwing things, and generally causing chaos wherever he goes. I've tried to be patient and understanding, but it's really difficult when I'm around him.   The other day, Sarah asked me if I wanted to come over for dinner with her and Kevin. I politely declined, saying that I was busy. She seemed disappointed, but she didn't push it.   Later that night, I ran into Sarah at the grocery store. She asked me again if I wanted to come over for dinner. I said something like, "Honestly, Sarah, I'm just not a big fan of being around Kevin."   She got really upset and accused me of being insensitive and judgmental. She said that I should love Kevin unconditionally because he's her son.   I tried to explain that I wasn't trying to be mean, but that I just find it hard to connect with him because of his behavior. But she wouldn't listen.   Now, I'm starting to wonder if I was wrong to say what I did. Was I too harsh? Should I have just lied and said I was busy?   AITA?

title: I'm a bit of a narcissist and it is hard to change that trait, but here are some things I've learned along the way
self_text: I have a friend who is also a narcissist. We both know we are narcissistic people, but he does not want to change that trait. He thinks it is part of his personality.  I am currently working on changing my narcissistic traits. It has been difficult. Here are some things I've learned about myself and other narcissists:   1. Narcissism is an inherent part of your personality. You can't just change that trait overnight. It takes years of therapy and self-reflection to overcome it.   2. Narcissists do not like criticism. They will lash out if you try to criticize them.   3. Narcissists need validation. They need to be told how great they are.  4. Narcissists often use others for their own gain. They will take advantage of others without thinking twice.   5. Narcissists are very insecure. They hide their insecurity by putting others down.  6. Narcissists think they are better than everyone else. They believe they are special and deserve more than everyone else.   7. Narcissists are manipulative. They will manipulate others to get what they want.  8. Narcissists have difficulty empathizing with others. They don't understand how others feel.   9. Narcissists are always right. They never admit when they are wrong.  10. Narcissists love attention. They crave attention and will do anything to get it.   If you are dealing with a narcissist, it is important to set boundaries. Do not let them control you. Do not give them validation. And most importantly, protect yourself.   Here are some resources for learning more about narcissism:   * [https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/basics/narcissism](https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/basics/narcissism)   * [https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/narcissistic-personality-disorder/symptoms-causes/syc-20366662](https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/narcissistic-personality-disorder/symptoms-causes/syc-20366662)   * [https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-to-deal-with-a-narcissist](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-to-deal-with-a-narcissist)

She's posted some pictures of them together lately, and I can't help but feel a little bit jealous. I know it's silly, because we're not even friends anymore. But I just can't shake the feeling that she's doing better without me.  I haven't talked to her about it, because I don't want to seem needy or clingy. But I just wanted to get it off my chest. Is this normal? Am I being ridiculous? Should I just try to move on?

I thought I had finally reached my breaking point when he started telling me that all of my friends are better than me and I should probably ditch them, I honestly don’t know if I can keep doing this anymore and maybe I should cut ties with him because it feels like I’m losing myself trying to please him.

title: Finally found a way to stop my intrusive thoughts that actually works for me!
self_text: I know it sounds weird but, I have been trying to get rid of these intrusive thoughts for years and nothing has worked before, not even therapy or medication. It’s like they were just a part of who I am. But then I started doing yoga and meditation every day and it helped me so much. I was able to learn how to control my thoughts and emotions and finally find some peace in my mind.  I can now focus on the things that are important to me without being distracted by negative thoughts. So if you’re struggling with intrusive thoughts, I hope this helps you too. It’s not easy but it is possible to overcome them and live a happy life.  It took me years to figure out what works for me, so don't give up if something doesn't work right away. Keep experimenting until you find something that does.   Thanks for reading!

title: Help me, I think I have a drinking problem.
self_text: I'm in my early 30s and I've been drinking for about 15 years. It started out as just a social thing, but it quickly became something more. I would drink every night after work to relax, and then on the weekends I would go out with friends and get drunk. I didn't think it was a big deal at first, but over time I realized that I was starting to rely on alcohol to cope with stress and anxiety.  I tried to cut back on my drinking several times, but I always ended up relapsing. I would tell myself that I could control it, but I couldn't. The more I drank, the more I wanted to drink.  A few months ago, I finally hit rock bottom. I got into a fight with my wife and I woke up the next morning with no memory of what had happened. I knew that I needed help, so I went to see a therapist.  My therapist told me that I have a drinking problem and that I need to get treatment. I agreed to go to rehab, and I'm currently in week three of my program.  It's been really hard, but I'm starting to feel better. I'm learning how to cope with stress and anxiety without turning to alcohol. I'm also rebuilding my relationship with my wife.  But I still have a long way to go. I know that relapse is always a possibility, but I'm determined to stay sober. I want to be a good husband, father, and friend. I want to live a life that I can be proud of.  If you are struggling with alcohol addiction, please reach out for help. There are people who care about you and want to support you. You are not alone.   Here are some resources that can help:  * National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA): https://www.niaaa.nih.gov/  * Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA): https://www.samhsa.gov/  * Alcoholics Anonymous (AA): https://www.aa.org/  * SMART Recovery: https://www.smartrecovery.org/

title: I'm not sure if my ex is still in love with me or if he just wants to be friends, and honestly it's starting to wear on me.
self_text: I know we haven't talked in a few months, but I keep seeing him online and every time I do I can't help but wonder what he's doing. It's like I'm stuck in a loop of wondering about him, even though I know that we're probably better off as friends.  I just don't understand why he won't talk to me. Does he think that I'm too good for him? Is he afraid that I'll hurt him again? Or does he just want to be friends?  I guess I'll never really know the answer, but it doesn't make it any easier. I wish he would just tell me how he feels so I could move on with my life.  I miss him so much, but I also know that we're not meant to be together. We both have our own lives to live, and we need to focus on those things instead of dwelling on the past.

I hate being in situations where there is awkward silence after I say something funny.  I can also get annoyed at people for making jokes about me (especially if they're not funny) and then getting mad when I don't laugh.  Is anyone else like this?

title: Is it possible to be a good person and enjoy making others angry?
self_text: I am not talking about malicious intent or wanting to hurt people, but rather being amused by their reactions when you challenge their worldview or push their buttons.  I always thought that if you want to make someone mad then you are just as bad as them for doing so, but recently I have been noticing how much of a dopamine rush it is for me when I can get someone to react with anger.  It feels like I’m proving my own intelligence and strength by causing such an emotional response in someone else.  Am I just a horrible person who has managed to convince himself he is better than everyone else? Or is there something normal about enjoying the mental stimulation that comes from stirring up controversy and debate?

title: Am I the only one who thinks that they are not a real person?
self_text: I am very confused right now and my life is falling apart, but I don’t think it’s real because I feel like I’m watching someone else live my life from behind the screen. Like when you play video games or watch movies. It just doesn't make sense to me why things happen to me. If I didn’t exist, then nothing would ever change, but things do change every day. How can things change if I’m not even there?

title: I'm pregnant and don't know how to tell my boyfriend
self_text: My boyfriend (25M) and I (24F) have been together for 6 months now, we live together, and he is amazing! He makes me laugh, treats me like a princess, and always supports my dreams. We had talked about having kids in the future but hadn't really discussed when or if we wanted them.  I found out last week that I was pregnant, I took multiple tests just to make sure it wasn't wrong. I've been so scared of telling him because I don't know how he will react, especially since we haven't talked about it much before. I also feel overwhelmed by all the things that come with pregnancy, like doctor appointments, morning sickness, and preparing for a baby.   Any advice on how to tell him? What should I say? How can I prepare myself for his reaction? Any stories from others who have been in similar situations would be greatly appreciated!

title: I think my boyfriend is a sociopath, what should i do?
self_text: My boyfriend and I (24M) have been together for about two years now, and in the past few months I've started to notice some things about him that really bother me. He's very charming and charismatic, but he also seems to lack empathy and has a tendency to manipulate people.   He always needs to be right, and if he's wrong, he'll just deny it or try to twist the situation around so that it looks like it was someone else's fault. He also gets angry easily when he doesn't get his way, and he can be very controlling.  I'm starting to feel scared of him, and I don't know what to do. Has anyone else been through something similar? Any advice would be greatly appreciated.

title: I need to stop falling in love with my friends, it’s exhausting
self_text: So here's the deal - I have a habit of developing feelings for my close friends (usually guys) and then being super bummed when they don't reciprocate. It happens pretty often, and honestly, it's getting old.  I start off just enjoying their company, thinking they're cool and funny, but then somehow those feelings morph into something more. And every time, it ends up being a disappointment because they either see me as just a friend or are already taken.  It feels like I can't just enjoy having male friends without my brain trying to turn it into something romantic. It makes things awkward and strained, and I end up withdrawing from friendships rather than dealing with the emotional fallout.  I know I should probably be focusing on myself and working on not seeking validation from others, but it's easier said than done. Any advice on how to break this pattern? Has anyone else been through something similar? How did you manage to get over your friends and move on?  Thanks in advance!

title: AITA for telling my brother to leave the house?
self_text: My (23M) brother (18M) has been staying with me and my parents since he graduated high school last year, he's a good kid but I think he's starting to take advantage of our hospitality. He doesn't have any job or schooling plans yet, so he spends most of his time playing video games, watching TV, and going out with friends.   My parents are really supportive of him and want him to be happy, but they also want him to start taking responsibility for himself. They've talked to him about getting a job or going back to school, but he just brushes them off.  I tried talking to him myself last week, but it didn't go well. He got defensive and accused me of being jealous of his freedom. I told him that wasn't true, but that I was worried about him. I said that if he doesn't start making an effort to get his life together, I'm going to ask him to move out.  He got really angry and started yelling at me, saying that I had no right to tell him what to do. He stormed out of the room and hasn't spoken to me since.  Now, my mom is mad at me for upsetting him and says that I should apologize. She thinks that I shouldn't have given him an ultimatum, and that I should just let him figure things out on his own.  I still stand by what I said, though. I love my brother, but I don't want him to waste his life away. And I don't think it's fair to us to continue supporting him when he's not even trying to help himself.  AITA for telling my brother to leave the house?

title: I am just confused as to why you are still here...

Now it’s more passive aggressive and manipulative.   I think she does things on purpose to get under my skin because she knows how much they bother me and then she acts like nothing happened.  She also doesn’t care about anyone except herself and her husband.  I have been trying to distance myself from her for months now but every time I do she gets mad at me and starts guilt tripping me or telling me how awful of a daughter I am.   I just don’t understand why she is so obsessed with controlling my life. It’s like she can’t stand the thought of me being happy without her approval.  I know she loves me but it’s not a healthy love and it’s exhausting to deal with.

What can we do to stop fighting and start communicating better? Should we go to couples therapy? Or are we just not compatible?

She didn't have much time to spend with me, so I felt really lonely and sad when I was sick. I remember lying in bed feeling sorry for myself and wishing my mom could just sit with me and read me a story or something. But she never did.  I know she was doing her best, but it still hurt a lot at the time. Now that I'm older, I realize how hard things must have been for her. But I can't help but feel sad when I think about those times. Has anyone else experienced this?

title: what's the most underrated anime of all time?
self_text: for me, it's "mushishi" (japanese title: mushishi) is a japanese anime series based on the manga series by yuki urushibara. it was directed by masahiko okura and produced by artland. the story follows ginko, a "musha-shi", who travels around in order to investigate incidents caused by mushi.   mushi are supernatural beings that can be described as spirits or organisms without a mind, but they can cause various phenomena that affect people's lives.  ginko doesn't destroy or exterminate mushi; he investigates them and tries to find a way for humans and mushi to coexist peacefully. i think it's an amazing show with beautiful animation, interesting characters, and a unique world.

title: I'm going to be a mom in about three months, and my husband is so supportive and loving. I feel like the luckiest woman in the world!
self_text: I love him so much, and I can't wait to start our family together. He's always there for me, no matter what, and he makes me laugh every single day. I know we're going to be great parents, and I can't wait to see what the future holds for us.

title: I want to feel normal again and I need advice please
self_text: So my boyfriend and I are having a lot of issues recently, and I am very anxious about it because he has been getting angry with me for no reason at all, like really angry. He also doesn’t talk to me about what is bothering him or why he gets mad, so that makes me even more nervous.  I have asked him if we can go to couples therapy but he said “we don’t need that” (but he is always talking about how much therapy helps other people) and I’ve tried talking to him about his anger but he says “you make me do it.”   He knows I love him and I care for him, but I think our relationship is hurting us both. It is making me question everything, like whether I should be in the relationship or not. I’m starting to see red flags everywhere now that I never noticed before, like how quickly he changes his mind on things, how dismissive he is when I tell him something important, and how often he tries to guilt trip me into doing stuff.   I just want things to go back to how they used to be, but I know that might not happen. I feel lost, confused, and I am scared to end the relationship because I don't want to hurt him.  Is there anyone else who has gone through something similar? How did you deal with it? Do you think ending the relationship would be the right thing to do? I really need some help and advice here. Thank you for listening.

title: I have a crush on my coworker and it’s killing me
self_text: So there’s this guy at work that I really like but he seems to not notice me and is always talking about his gf, what should I do?

title: I have been trying to get out of my shell for years but it’s just not working. How do I change?
self_text: Please help me with any advice you can give, and thank you in advance!

title: Is there a way to tell if someone is going through a lot or not?
self_text: I’m just wondering if anyone knows how you can tell when someone has had something difficult happen recently, but they aren’t telling anyone about it.   I was talking with my friend the other day and she seemed really quiet and distant, which isn’t like her at all. She didn’t seem to want to talk about anything in particular and kept changing the subject whenever I tried to ask her what was up.  I asked her if everything was ok, but she said that it was fine and that she was just tired. I wanted to press her further, but I didn’t want to make her feel uncomfortable. I don’t know if she’s hiding something from me or not, but I just have a feeling that something is wrong.  I don’t want to pry too much, but I also don’t want her to think that I don’t care about her.  Has anyone else ever been in this situation before? How did you handle it? Any advice would be appreciated. Thanks!

title: I think my friend is in love with me
self_text: So I met him during my freshman year of college, and we became friends immediately. He's a really nice guy, but he has been very clingy. For example, he will text me constantly, even when I don't respond to his texts or calls. He also gets upset if I spend time with other people without inviting him along.  I just want to be able to hang out with my friends without having to worry about him getting jealous or mad. It’s so annoying because I like him as a friend, but I don’t see him as anything more than that.  What should I do? Should I talk to him about it? Or should I just try to distance myself from him?

title: is it weird to want my bf to be a bit more like the guys on the shows i watch?
self_text: so i’ve been watching a lot of romance shows lately and tbh some of the stuff they do for their partners is just really cute and sweet. my boyfriend isn’t exactly that way, he doesn’t really do grand gestures or big displays of affection (he’s not cold or anything, he does care about me), but he also doesn’t go out of his way to make me feel special in those kinds of ways. i’m wondering if it’s weird that i kinda wish he was more like them. i know they’re actors playing characters and shit, and my bf has his own personality etc, but it still gets me thinking. what do you think?

title: My wife's ex husband is trying to break up our marriage
self_text: I know it sounds like a bad movie but that's what's happening and I don't know what to do.  I have been married for about 6 years and we are very happy. We have no kids together but my wife has two daughters from her previous relationship. Her ex-husband and I get along well enough, he is often over at the house with his daughters and we all go out together. He always seems to be talking about how great of a dad he is and how much his daughters love him.   Last month, she was at work when she got a text from him saying "I miss you." She showed me the message and we both laughed it off as something silly. But then it started again. Texts, calls, messages on social media. He would always try to make it seem like it was just innocent flirting but it was clear he wanted more.   My wife told him to stop contacting her and he did for a few weeks. Then last night, she got another text from him saying "I can't stop thinking about you." This time, she didn't laugh it off. She was really upset and said she was scared.   I tried to calm her down and told her that he was probably just trying to manipulate her. But then she told me something that made my blood run cold. She said that he had been telling their daughters that he and she were still in love and that they should try to get back together.   I am furious. How dare he involve our children in his selfish games? I want to confront him but I don't want to make things worse. I don't want to scare him or push him away. I just want him to leave us alone.   What should I do?

title: My friend has been diagnosed with a personality disorder and I don't know how to act around him anymore
self_text: He is very erratic and manipulative, he always thinks the worst of me (and everyone) even though I have done nothing wrong and will often try to make me feel bad about myself.  He also likes to play mind games and loves being dramatic so it feels like walking on eggshells around him all the time.   I can no longer trust anything that comes out of his mouth because he is constantly lying or exaggerating. \n\nI love my friend but I can see that our friendship isn’t good for either of us. Is it okay to cut ties? It doesn’t seem like there is any chance of saving the friendship now that he is in therapy and still acting this way.

title: I’m not sure if my gf is really a gf or just a friend with benefits and she doesn’t know the difference
self_text: So I met her about a month ago at work, we were both working as security guards for an event and we got talking after her shift ended and started chatting on snapchat that night and it was going good until I told her I wanted to take her out sometime. Then she said “we can be friends” but still kept snapping me every day so I decided to ignore her because I didn’t want to go down the friend zone path. Fast forward a few weeks later and she starts texting me again saying she has no friends and wants someone to talk to (which is fair) so I started talking to her again and eventually asked if she would like to come over to my house and hang out which she did. We hung out and watched movies and stuff but nothing happened between us physically and then when she left she went back to ignoring me for another week before coming back again with “I have no friends lol”. This cycle continued for about 3 weeks until last night where she texted me asking if I could pick her up from work and bring her home which I did. When we arrived at her place she thanked me and gave me a hug before going inside and that’s where things changed. She started flirting with me and telling me how cute I am and wanting to kiss me and stuff, I was shocked by all of this since it wasn’t happening before so I let her kiss me and things escalated quickly. After that we spent the whole night together having sex multiple times and she even slept over in my bed. Now I’m confused because I don’t know what her intentions are and if she’s actually interested in being with me or if she just needed to get laid. Any advice?

title: my parents won't let me see my girlfriend
self_text: i’m a 16 year old boy and my parents don’t like my girlfriend. they say she is not good enough for me, but she really is. she is kind, intelligent, funny, and beautiful. we have been dating for about six months now, and we are very happy together. my parents are worried that she will get me into trouble, but she has never done anything to hurt me. they also worry that she is too young for me, but she is the same age as me. i love her so much and i want to be with her, but my parents won’t let me. what should i do?

title: I have a crush on someone who is in my class
self_text: He’s really cute and we talk sometimes but I don’t know if he likes me back or not, so I want to make him like me. We were talking about something and he started laughing at what I said which was hilarious, then I started laughing too, so we both ended up laughing a lot and it felt amazing!  I think that moment made me fall for him even more because it showed me how much fun we can have together. But I’m worried about ruining our friendship if I confess my feelings. Should I just keep being friends with him or should I tell him how I feel? What do you guys think?

How do you tell someone that you need space from them?

How do you tell someone that you need space from them?

title: AITA for taking my friend’s son to a water park?
self_text: My friend “Jen” (45F) has an autistic son, “Sam” (10M). Sam loves the water and is very good at swimming, but he needs help with changing and getting ready for his swim. I am very close to Jen and have been friends since we were kids.  I used to take Sam to a local pool every week as part of a volunteer program for autistic children, where I would help him get changed, help him in the water, and then help him change again after the session. After Covid hit, the sessions got cancelled, so I stopped going with Sam. We still hang out, though.   A few weeks ago, Sam was telling me about wanting to go to a water park nearby that had a lot of slides, but he said Jen hadn’t taken him because she didn’t want to deal with all the chaos of crowds and noise. He said she also wasn’t sure how she could handle helping him get changed while dealing with crowds.  I asked her if I could take him myself, which she agreed to. I told her I wanted to take him on a day when it wouldn’t be too busy, so she suggested next Wednesday morning, before schools got out. So, I took Sam to the water park last Wednesday. It wasn’t super crowded and he really enjoyed himself. I helped him get changed and made sure he had sunscreen on, and we went on some slides together.   When I dropped Sam off back home, Jen thanked me for taking him and said he had a great time. She mentioned that she felt bad for not being able to take him herself, but she was glad he got to go. But then she started complaining about how long it took to pick up her groceries. She said she was exhausted from running errands and needed a break. I just listened patiently and nodded along.  But then she turned to me and said, “You know, you should have offered to help me with the groceries.” I replied, “What?” She repeated, “Well, you picked up Sam, why couldn’t you pick up my groceries?” I told her that I had already promised to take Sam to the water park and didn’t think it was appropriate to add another errand onto the trip. She responded by saying that I was being unhelpful and that I always make excuses whenever she asks for help.  She said that I only offer to do things when they benefit me, like taking Sam to the water park because I enjoy spending time with him. I was shocked. I had spent hours with Sam, making sure he had fun and staying safe, and now she was accusing me of doing it for selfish reasons? I tried to explain that I genuinely wanted to take Sam and that I didn’t mind helping him, but she wouldn’t listen. She kept interrupting me and insisting that I was being inconsiderate.   I ended the conversation abruptly and left. Now I feel guilty about what happened, even though I don’t think I did anything wrong. Was I the asshole for not offering to pick up her groceries after taking Sam to the water park?

title: AITA for asking my friend to stop drinking with me?
self_text: So, I (23F) have been friends with “Sarah” (24F) since high school and we’ve always had a lot in common. We both like similar music, movies, books, etc. but recently she’s been getting into partying and drinking a lot more than usual and it’s starting to bother me because I don’t really enjoy being around her when she’s drunk.  She usually drinks beer and sometimes wine or cocktails. She also smokes weed but only occasionally.  I’m not against people having fun and enjoying themselves, but I just can’t stand being around someone who is drunk. It makes me feel anxious and uncomfortable.  I told her that I didn’t want to drink with her anymore because it made me feel bad and I wanted to be able to spend time with her without feeling pressured to drink too.  She got really upset and said that I was ruining our friendship and that I was being judgmental of her choices.  I tried to explain to her that it wasn’t about judging her, but about how her behavior affects me. But she wouldn’t listen and eventually stormed off.  Now I feel awful because I didn’t mean to hurt her feelings, but I also don’t want to spend time with her if she’s going to be drunk all the time.  AITA?

title: Am I the only one who’s afraid of having kids?
self_text: My husband and I have been married for 4 years now, we were together for 3 before that so we have been together for a total of 7 years. We are both financially stable, have a nice home and love each other very much but when it comes to starting a family I just can’t get over my fear. I know people say “It’s normal to be scared” or “You will never feel ready” but honestly, I don’t think I want kids. It’s not like I don’t like them, in fact I adore them! But I am still terrified about being pregnant, giving birth and raising a child.   I was raised by an emotionally abusive mother who made my childhood hell on earth. She was always comparing me to others, she told me I wasn’t good enough, she would yell at me for no reason and I had to walk on eggshells around her all the time.  My husband’s parents also weren’t the best parents. His dad has BPD and his mom is passive aggressive. They often criticize him and make him feel inadequate.   I think because of our bad upbringing, we are both terrified of repeating the same mistakes with our own children.   We have talked about going to therapy but haven’t gotten around to doing it yet. I wish someone could tell me how they overcame their fear of becoming a parent so I can use some advice.

title: I (18m) have been with my gf (20f) for about 4 years now, and recently she’s started talking to her ex (26m), who is a bit of an asshole
self_text: So me and my gf are in our senior year of high school, and we’ve been together for almost 4 years now. She’s really into music, and he’s pretty much the only person who understands that side of her. He was like her best friend before they broke up about a year ago, and we hung out with him a lot when we were all friends. We haven’t seen him since then though. A few months ago, she said she wanted to hang out with him again, but I didn’t want her to because he would probably just take advantage of her. But I didn’t say anything, because I didn’t think it would be fair to tell her what to do. Last week, she texted him saying she missed him, and he replied back saying he missed her too. She asked if they could meet up sometime soon, and he agreed. They met up on Friday night, and she told me everything afterwards. She said that it was nice to catch up, and that they talked about their relationship and how it ended. She also said that he apologized for being such an asshole, and that he wants to be friends again. I’m really worried about this, because I don’t trust him at all. I know that he’s still attracted to her, and I don’t want him to try to win her back. I also don’t want her to get hurt again. What should I do?
